Isaac Chan, Business  at NUSLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 27 Feb 2019There are a few ways that you can consider. This is just something very preliminary. Check out this article by the Motely Fool for more specifics of the different asset classes. https://www.fool.com/investing/2018/08/29/3-ways-to-invest-in-a-renewable-energy-future.aspxEquities ETFsETFs help to give you exposure over a range of investments and help to diversify some firm specific risk away. You could consider being exposed to a specific type of renewable energy, or a range of renewable energy. Some popular ones include Guggenheim Solar ETF and iShares Global Clean Energy ETFBondsBonds may be issued by companies to complete certain energy projects or to raise capital.
